translation.en: [man in Chichewa] Father!
[man] John! John!
[man, in English] No one is responsible for the death of this man.
translation.es: Nadie es responsable por la muerte de este hombre.

translation.en: God alone has decided to take John Kamkwamba.
translation.es: Dios ha decidido llevarse a John Kamkwamba.

translation.en: When God has decided, then we will know the man by what remains.
translation.es: Cuando Dios ha decidido, conocemos al hombre por lo que queda.

translation.en: By the fruit shall we know the tree.
translation.es: Por el fruto conocemos el árbol.

translation.en: And we have fruit here.
The fruit of the land farmed by John and his younger brother, Trywell,
translation.es: El fruto de la tierra que John y su hermano menor, Trywell,

translation.en: since they returned from Dowa nearly 20 years ago,
translation.es: cultivaron tras retornar de Dowa hace casi 20 años.

translation.en: and worked this land together side by side, these two brothers.
translation.es: Ambos hermanos cultivaron esta tierra codo a codo.

translation.en: But there are other fruits from John Kamkwamba,
translation.es: Pero hay otros frutos de John Kamkwamba.

translation.en: many offspring born to him.
His children, led by his eldest son, Jeremiah,
translation.es: Su prole, liderada por su hijo mayor, Jeremiah,

translation.en: who must now take over the work of his departed father.
translation.es: quien ahora debe continuar la labor de su difunto padre.

translation.en: -And if the fruit is good, then it must... -[chanting]
translation.es: Y si el fruto es bueno, debe...

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Give me my radio.
Did you fix Mr. Bamusi's? No, sir. Not yet.
translation.es: - ¿Reparaste la del Sr. Bamusi? - No, señor. Aún no.

translation.en: Go and check the roof.
[woman in Chichewa] There are heavy cloud formations moving across the southwest...
translation.es: Grandes formaciones de nubes se mueven por el sudoeste.

translation.en: -[in Chichewa] Morning, Papa. -Sleep better?
[whispers in Chichewa] Put it on his bed.
-[man] Good morning. -[woman] Good morning to you.
-Bad dreams again? -Yes, hardly slept.
translation.es: - ¿Pesadillas otra vez? - Sí. Casi no dormí.

translation.en: William! You want Shabani to help you?
No, Ma. I'm fine.
[in English] William, where's my radio?
[in English] Mr. Bamusi, please, just a few more days.
translation.es: Sr. Bamusi, deme unos días más, por favor.

translation.en: I'm finding the problem. It's not the condenser.
translation.es: Aún no sé qué falla. No es el condensador.

translation.en: I've told your father. I'm missing my programs, William.
translation.es: Ya le dije a tu padre que me estoy perdiendo mis programas.

translation.en: William, if you can't fix it,
you have to give Mr. Bamusi back his money.
translation.es: debes devolverle el dinero al Sr. Bamusi.

translation.en: A few days, Mr. Bamusi. I promise.
translation.es: Unos días más, Sr. Bamusi. Se lo prometo.

translation.en: He's forcing me to come back from work and talk to my wife and children.
translation.es: Me obliga a conversar con mi familia al volver del trabajo.

translation.en: [chuckles] William. [in Chichewa] Make sure you wash before you go inside.
[in Chichewa] Yes, Ma.
[William] Papa! Papa!
[in Chichewa] Thank you, Papa! Thank you!
Oh, my God! Where is my son? Who has taken my son?
translation.es: ¡Por Dios! ¿Dónde está mi hijo? ¿Quién se lo llevó?

translation.en: -Look at the trousers! -It's okay. It's okay.
translation.es: - ¡Mira esos pantalones! - Está bien. Muy bien.

translation.en: Who brought this man here?
Doesn't he know that I love my husband? Leave the boy alone.
translation.es: - ¿No sabe que amo a mi marido? - Ya deja al chico en paz.

translation.en: Is he a doctor from Lilongwe or an engineer from Chimamba?
translation.es: ¿Es un médico de Lilongwe o un ingeniero de Chimamba?

translation.en: -It's not too big? -It's perfect.
Dear Father,
we thank you for all the blessings you have laid on this family.
translation.es: te agradecemos por las bendiciones que trajiste a esta familia.

translation.en: Please continue to fight for us, so we may endure any hardship.
translation.es: Sigue luchando para que podamos superar cualquier adversidad.

translation.en: -In Jesus's name, Amen. -Amen.
translation.es: - En el nombre de Jesús. - Amén.

translation.en: When I was a boy, the elders sometimes hadn't recorded everyone's exact age.
translation.es: Cuando era niño, los ancianos no llevaban registro de la edad de nadie.

translation.en: But there was a simple test.
If you could touch your left ear over your head with your right hand,
translation.es: Si podías tocarte la oreja izquierda con la mano derecha por sobre la cabeza,

translation.en: you could go to school. [chuckles]
The first time I tried, I was too small.
translation.es: La primera vez que lo intenté, era demasiado pequeño.

translation.en: I couldn't reach.
Do it.
That was for you to go to primary school, Papa.
translation.es: Era para ir a la escuela primaria, papá.

translation.en: -Of course I can do it. -I know.
translation.es: - Claro que puedo hacerlo. - Lo sé.

translation.en: Go to school.
-[in English] Looking sharp, man. -You too, man. [laughs]
[Gilbert] I think this is a bit too loose for you. -[William] Room to grow, room to grow. -[both laugh]
translation.es: - Los pantalones te quedan sueltos. - Para cuando crezca.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] One phosphorus, one more organic.
translation.es: Uno de fósforo, uno más orgánico.

translation.en: -You want an ox cart? -No, I brought the bike.
translation.es: - ¿Quieres una carreta con bueyes? - No. Compré una bicicleta.

translation.en: There's flooding in Mozambique.
Mozambique?
I've heard it on the radio.
[in Chichewa] Justina's relatives found her a job at the agricultural ministry.
translation.es: Los parientes de Justina le consiguieron empleo en el Ministerio de Agricultura.

translation.en: Don't worry.
After university, you'll have no problem finding a job.
translation.es: Luego de ir a la universidad, hallarás empleo fácilmente.

translation.en: You'll do things even I didn't think women could do.
translation.es: Harás cosas que no creía que una mujer pudiera hacer.

translation.en: [crowd chanting in Chichewa] N.U.P. government! N.U.P. government!
Another six months of this bullshit.
translation.es: Seis meses más de esta basura.

translation.en: You know the president is even coming to Kasungu.
translation.es: Sabes que el presidente incluso vendrá a Kasungu.

translation.en: Democracy.
Democracy is just like imported cassava.
translation.es: La democracia es como la yuca importada.

translation.en: It rots quickly.
[in English] Of course, Kachokolo is not the wealthiest school in the district,
translation.es: Kachokolo no es la escuela más rica del distrito,

translation.en: but it's down to each one of you to decide your own level of commitment.
translation.es: pero ustedes son quienes deciden cuánto quieren comprometerse.

translation.en: -Your own level of what? -[pupils] Commitment!
We have had students excel in their junior certificate
translation.es: Muchos de nuestros alumnos se han destacado en el primer año.

translation.en: and some of them have even gone on to university.
translation.es: Algunos incluso han ido a la universidad.

translation.en: Did these people have two heads?
-[pupils] No, Mr. Headmaster. -[thunder rumbling]
-What did they not have? -[pupils] Two heads!
translation.es: - ¿Qué es lo que no tenían? - ¡Dos cabezas!

translation.en: [headmaster] They worked hard. Simple as that. What did they do?
translation.es: Se esforzaron mucho. Es así de sencillo. ¿Qué hicieron?

translation.en: [pupils] Worked hard.
When we have received the full payment for the term,
translation.es: Cuando hayamos recibido el pago total para el año escolar,

translation.en: you will receive your library card from Mrs. Sikelo.
translation.es: la señora Sikelo les dará su credencial para la biblioteca.

translation.en: -[wind whistling] -What will I give you?
[pupils] Library cards.
Your library cards will allow you to take some books home overnight.
translation.es: Las credenciales les permitirán llevarse libros a casa.

translation.en: So, with dedication, there's no reason--
translation.es: Si se esfuerzan, no hay motivo...

translation.en: Everybody, go to your form rooms.
Your form teachers will take you through the rest of the day's activities.
translation.es: Sus maestros les mostrarán el resto de las actividades del día.

translation.en: [man] Everybody, find your seat. Find your seat.
Your first day of school and the rains have come.
translation.es: Las lluvias llegaron en su primer día de escuela.

translation.en: A good sign, I wonder.
My name is Mr. Kachigunda.
I will be your form tutor and science teacher for the year.
translation.es: Seré su tutor y su maestro de ciencias este año.

translation.en: -Good morning. -[pupils] Good morning, Mr. Kachigunda.
translation.es: - Buen día. - Buen día, señor Kachigunda.

translation.en: Take your seats.
Okay, let's get right on with it. Basic algebra: x and y.
translation.es: Bien. Comencemos. Álgebra básica: x y z.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Mr. Godsten.
Mama said that Justina left for Lilongwe. Yes, she's gone.
translation.es: - Mamá dice que Justina se fue a Lilongwe. - Sí, se fue.

translation.en: Do you need help here?
Not any we can afford.
Will you let me know if you hear of any work in the market?
translation.es: ¿Me avisa si oye de algún empleo en el mercado?

translation.en: Of course.
[William] Mr. Kachigunda.
[in English] It's from my sister, Annie, for her university placement.
translation.es: Es de mi hermana, Annie, para su inscripción en la universidad.

translation.en: You're William Kamkwamba?
Yes, sir.
Tell your father to pay the fees.
translation.es: Di a tu padre que pague la matrícula.

translation.en: He's paid, sir.
Only the down payment. There's no grace period here.
translation.es: Solo el anticipo. No hay período de gracia aquí.

translation.en: Tell your father to pay the rest or you won't be allowed to come to school.
translation.es: Que tu padre pague el resto o no podrás venir a la escuela.

translation.en: Yes, sir. He'll pay, sir.
Good.
William, look who's been waiting.
Khamba!
[in Chichewa] William, it's too dark.
We have a science test.
-Can I use kerosene? -There's not enough for studying.
Go and help your father plant.
translation.es: Ayuda a tu padre a plantar.

translation.en: [in English] That's okay.
You need to see me after class.
William, you can do better. Gilbert, I'm not so sure.
translation.es: William, puedes hacerlo mejor. Gilbert, no estoy tan seguro.

translation.en: That's good.
-[Gilbert] At least you passed. -[William] Sixty-two is not enough.
translation.es: - Por lo menos aprobaste. - Un 62 % no es suficiente.

translation.en: We need to go to the junkyard. We need to find a way to study at night.
translation.es: Debemos ir al desguace y hallar el modo de estudiar por la noche.

translation.en: [William] There's been a delivery.
[Gilbert] It's just more shit from the tobacco estate.
translation.es: Solo es más mierda de la tabacalera.

translation.en: [Gilbert] Anything new?
It's a pump.
Hey!
[man] When the tobacco estates moved south,
translation.es: Cuando las tabacaleras se mudaron al sur,

translation.en: it made it hard for us to compete to grow tobacco.
translation.es: ya no pudimos competir por el cultivo de tabaco.

translation.en: And then they took the trees to burn to dry their tobacco leaves.
translation.es: Luego talaron los árboles para quemar y secar las hojas de tabaco.

translation.en: We once had a beautiful country that my son will never see.
translation.es: Solíamos tener un país hermoso que mi hijo no verá.

translation.en: [man 2] We have been instructed by the estate
to offer 2,000 kwacha per tonne of forestry.
translation.es: que ofrezcamos 2000 kwacha por tonelada de silvicultura.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Papa, what's going on? They're taking the trees?
Who said you could come to the meeting?
translation.es: ¿Quién te autorizó a venir a la reunión?

translation.en: Gilbert is allowed. [Trywell] And so? Go!
Go!
[man 2 in English] Of course, if you don't want to take this opportunity,
translation.es: Si no quieren aceptar esta oferta,

translation.en: we will be forced to take our business elsewhere.
translation.es: llevaremos nuestros negocios a otra parte.

translation.en: [man 2] Let the chief speak. Let the chief speak.
Of course, the estates know that the rains came late this year,
translation.es: Las tabacaleras saben que las lluvias se demoraron este año

translation.en: and they have come heavy.
They know that there has been flooding in Mozambique.
translation.es: Saben que hubo inundaciones en Mozambique.

translation.en: They know that without finances, we can't build proper defenses,
translation.es: Saben que sin dinero no podemos construir defensas

translation.en: and so we rely on the trees.
They watch for every pressure on us small people, so they can take from us.
translation.es: Ejercen presión sobre el pueblo para poder llevarse lo que es nuestro.

translation.en: The only power we have is to say no.
translation.es: Solo tenemos el poder de decir "no".

translation.en: This is a gross mischaracterization of the estate's agenda.
translation.es: Están malinterpretando las intenciones de la tabacalera.

translation.en: We want to work with you people. [man 3] I'll sign.
translation.es: - Queremos trabajar con ustedes. - Yo firmaré.

translation.en: -Company man, I will sign. -For 2,000?
-[man 3] I'll sign. -Jeremiah.
Listen to the chief. Two thousand is not enough.
translation.es: Escucha al jefe. Dos mil no son suficientes.

translation.en: [in English] The chief can decide his own. I can decide my own.
translation.es: El jefe decide por él mismo. Yo tomo mis decisiones.

translation.en: This is madness. We need the money. I will sign.
translation.es: Es una locura. Necesitamos el dinero. Firmaré.

translation.en: Who else will sign with Jeremiah?
We can only guarantee this price for today.
[whispers] Jeremiah.
[man 2] Think of your families.
[in Chichewa] I'll sign.
[man 4] I'll sign.
[Trywell in Chichewa] These trees protect us from flooding.
Why do you think your father never sold them?
translation.es: ¿Por qué crees que tu padre no los vendió?

translation.en: We'll make more money this way.
There's flooding in Mozambique. Mozambique?
I have debts in Kasungu.
Then stop gambling.
Don't worry, Uncle Trywell.
I'll support you and your family, just like my father did.
translation.es: Los ayudaré a ti y a tu familia como lo hizo mi padre.

translation.en: You keep spending your money educating your kids,
translation.es: Gastas tu dinero en educar a tus hijos

translation.en: just so they can leave you.
translation.es: para que ellos luego te dejen.

translation.en: The smart ones will get the hell out of here.
translation.es: Los listos se largarán de aquí.

translation.en: And I promise you,
when I have enough money to go,
translation.es: ...que cuando tenga suficiente dinero para irme...

translation.en: I'll give you my land.
I don't want your land.
Then my father was right...
not to leave it to you.
There's nothing wrong with gambling.
translation.es: Apostar no tiene nada de malo.

translation.en: Look at how these rains have been these last few years.
translation.es: Mira las lluvias de los últimos años.

translation.en: We're all gambling.
-[dog whines] -[whispers in English] Stay, Khamba.
[man in Chichewa] I asked her why they would send a beautiful woman down here.
translation.es: Le pregunté por qué enviaban a una mujer bella aquí.

translation.en: She started smiling like this...
So, what happened?
What did you do with her?
You people let children in here now?
He's got brains.
So? How can I talk in front of children?
Which children?
What do you know about women?
I know absolutely everything you know.
translation.es: Sé todo lo que tú sabes.

translation.en: [man] What is it?
I told you. These batteries are dying.
translation.es: Te dije que las baterías están gastadas.

translation.en: -You have more? -They're all dead.
The game's starting. What do we do now?
[mother in Chichewa] Annie, is that you?
[William] No.
Papa.
Should I take my fees with me to school tomorrow morning?
translation.es: ¿Llevo la matrícula a la escuela mañana?

translation.en: When the rains stop,
and we're sure of the harvest, we'll pay the fees.
translation.es: y sepamos si cosecharemos, pagaremos la matrícula.

translation.en: -But sir-- -You were at the meeting.
They're taking down the trees.
The land could flood.
[William in English] Radios use a lot of power,
so when the batteries die, there's usually a bit of juice at the end.
translation.es: Cuando las baterías se gastan, siempre queda un poco de carga.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] So if we put a few dead ones together...
[newsreader in English] ...took place at 8:46 a.m.
And the second plane struck the South Tower
translation.es: El segundo avión chocó contra la torre sur

translation.en: at 9:03 a.m. Eastern Standard Time.
translation.es: a las 9:03 de la mañana, hora del este de EE. UU.

translation.en: -The American president, George W. Bush... -Find the game!
translation.es: - El presidente George W. Bush... - ¡Busca el partido!

translation.en: [Gilbert in English] Look! Look!
-[Annie laughs] -It's Mr. Kachigunda and your sister.
translation.es: Son el Sr. Kachigunda y tu hermana.

translation.en: Did you know?
-You can't tell anyone about this. -[Gilbert] I won't.
translation.es: - No se lo cuentes a nadie. - No lo haré.

translation.en: [Gilbert] What are you going to do?
You can't just let him get away with it.
translation.es: No dejes que se salga con la suya.

translation.en: What if he disgraces her and tells everybody?
translation.es: ¿Y si él la deshonra y se lo cuenta a todos?

translation.en: Let me check the car battery.
-It's dead. -Let me check.
Is that how she was able to attend senior classes?
translation.es: ¿Por eso ella pudo asistir a clases de último año?

translation.en: What do you mean?
He was her teacher.
He must have helped her.
That's why she got the grades for university,
translation.es: Por eso obtuvo notas para la universidad

translation.en: and we're struggling even to get a junior certificate.
translation.es: mientras que a nosotros nos cuesta aprobar el primer año.

translation.en: She got good grades because she studied at night.
translation.es: Obtuvo buenas notas porque estudió de noche.

translation.en: I remember. We had had money for kerosene back then.
You could use this.
To do what?
If you break his bike, you think he'll walk all the way to the village?
translation.es: Si rompes su bicicleta, él no irá caminando al pueblo.

translation.en: -It's this one. -Yeah, that's it.
-I can't. -Huh?
Take the light.
Take it, and then you'll be able to study at night.
translation.es: Llévatela y podrás estudiar de noche.

translation.en: It's not coming off.
Turn the pedal.
Stop.
Start again.
-[in Chichewa] I had 5,200. -Is that everything?
William's schooling?
[Trywell] After the harvest.
[mother] He needs schooling, Trywell.
translation.es: Debe ir a la escuela, Trywell.

translation.en: You want him spending time with those useless boys?
translation.es: ¿Quieres que se relacione con esos chicos buenos para nada?

translation.en: His mind is just like Annie's.
translation.es: Su mente es como la de Annie.

translation.en: -Like my mother's. -[Trywell] Your mother's? That mad woman.
translation.es: - Como la de mi madre. - ¿Tu madre? Esa mujer loca.

translation.en: Was it madness when she came and built the extension?
translation.es: ¿Fue una locura que ella construyera el otro cuarto?

translation.en: Making bricks all day at her age is what killed her.
translation.es: Fabricar ladrillos a su edad fue lo que la mató.

translation.en: And we still use it.
The children get it from her.
translation.es: Los niños lo heredaron de ella.

translation.en: From my side.
Not from mine?
You're clever enough. You found me, didn't you?
translation.es: Eres listo. Me encontraste a mí, ¿no?

translation.en: That was just luck. [chuckling]
Just because you were in the marketplace that time.
translation.es: Porque estabas en el mercado en ese momento.

translation.en: We need to save everything we can.
translation.es: Debemos ahorrar todo lo que podamos.

translation.en: There's no money for school fees.
translation.es: No hay para pagar la matrícula.

translation.en: Not right now.
[headmaster in English] Phiri, Nyangu, Kamchulu,
Muzombe, Lukwa, Kamanga,
Kamkwamba, and Nkhoma.
If your name has been called, please stay here.
translation.es: Si oyeron su nombre, quédense aquí.

translation.en: Everyone else, go to class.
translation.es: Los demás pueden ir a clase.

translation.en: Your school fees have still not been paid. There is no grace period.
translation.es: Aún no han pagado su matrícula. No hay período de gracia.

translation.en: Please go home and collect the fees if you wish to continue your studies.
translation.es: Vayan a sus casas a buscar el dinero si desean seguir estudiando.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] I'll go to the auction house. I'll talk to Daniel Ngwata.
translation.es: Iré a la casa de subastas. Hablaré con Daniel Ngwata.

translation.en: Daniel?
You haven't seen him for years.
translation.es: Hace años que no lo ves.

translation.en: Maybe he can talk to the estate.
translation.es: Quizá él pueda hablar con la tabacalera.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] How do you know this man, Papa?
An old friend.
[man] Trywell.
-[in English] So long. Too long. -Good to see you.
translation.es: - Ha pasado mucho tiempo. - Qué gusto verte.

translation.en: Is this big man William? Wow. It's been too long.
translation.es: ¿Este hombre es William? Sí que pasó mucho tiempo.

translation.en: This way, please.
I have some small savings from when we were in business in Dowa.
translation.es: Tengo algunos ahorros de nuestro negocio en Dowa.

translation.en: But I can use some of it to buy back the trees on Kamkwamba land
translation.es: Puedo usarlos para comprar los árboles en las tierras Kamkwamba

translation.en: for the price they were bought for. They won't do that.
translation.es: - por el mismo precio. - No aceptarán eso.

translation.en: No, if you tell them the land is flooding.
translation.es: Debes decirles que las tierras se inundan.

translation.en: We're losing the harvest.
Trywell, they won't do that. Why would they do that?
translation.es: Trywell, no aceptarán. ¿Por qué lo harían?

translation.en: Jeremiah sold the trees.
Why didn't your brother leave you that land?
translation.es: ¿Por qué no te dio tu hermano esas tierras?

translation.en: -You worked hard on that land. -I don't know.
translation.es: - Las trabajaste mucho. - No lo sé.

translation.en: He should have left it to you to take care of the family.
translation.es: Debería haber dejado que te ocuparas de la familia.

translation.en: It was John's land to leave to whoever he wants to leave it to.
translation.es: John podía dejarle las tierras a quien él deseara.

translation.en: The Pope. [laughing]
The Pope.
That's what we used to call your father back then.
translation.es: Así le decíamos a tu padre en ese entonces.

translation.en: The most honest man in all of Dowa market.
translation.es: El hombre más honesto del mercado de Dowa.

translation.en: We used to laugh at him
because what good can come from an honest businessman?
translation.es: ¿Un hombre de negocios honesto? No sirve.

translation.en: We used to laugh at him, until he had carried off the most beautiful woman in the whole place.
translation.es: Nos reímos de él hasta que se llevó a la mujer más bella del mercado.

translation.en: For farming.
[in Chichewa] For farming.
[in English] How is Agnes?
Can you help us, Daniel?
The rains, Trywell.
What can anybody do about these rains?
translation.es: ¿Qué se puede hacer sobre la lluvia?

translation.en: This year, the land is too wet. Next year, too dry.
translation.es: Este año, la tierra está mojada. El que viene, seca.

translation.en: You can't do business like that.
translation.es: Así no se pueden hacer negocios.

translation.en: All indications have been that the grain harvest
translation.es: Todo indica que la cosecha de granos

translation.en: would be good this year.
Even the International Monetary Fund, the World Bank, told the government to sell all the excess grain
translation.es: El FMI y el Banco Mundial le dijeron al gobierno que venda granos

translation.en: to Mozambique and Kenya.
And so they did.
Now what's happened? The floods have come.
And no one knows if there is enough grain in this whole country
translation.es: Nadie sabe si hay suficiente grano en el país

translation.en: to protect the farmers.
The government will protect the farmers.
translation.es: El gobierno protegerá a los agricultores.

translation.en: Terrorists have attacked America.
translation.es: Hubo un ataque terrorista en EE. UU.

translation.en: You must have heard it.
All the markets are in free fall.
All these government debts being recalled.
translation.es: Quieren cobrar las deudas del gobierno.

translation.en: Forget about the trees.
Forget about the savings.
When these rains stop and the sun returns,
translation.es: Cuando la lluvia cese y salga el sol,

translation.en: Malawi is preparing for a very long hungry season.
translation.es: a Malaui le espera una larga hambruna.

translation.en: [Trywell in English] The roots are all weak,
and now the sun is drying out the land,
translation.es: y ahora el sol seca la tierra,

translation.en: but when the president comes to Kasungu, there will be journalists there,
translation.es: pero cuando el presidente venga a Kasungu, habrá reporteros

translation.en: and other chiefs.
You could say something.
[in Chichewa] We can't threaten the president.
[Trywell in Chichewa] It's not threats.
We have to protect ourselves.
[in English] You just let them know that we know what is happening.
translation.es: Solo dígales que sabemos lo que sucede.

translation.en: [man] Do you think the government will leave everyone here to die?
translation.es: ¿Cree que el gobierno permitirá que todos muramos?

translation.en: [Trywell in Chichewa] I don't know,
but why should we sit here waiting to find out?
[in Chichewa] There was a problem before, 20 years ago.
translation.es: Ya hubo problemas antes, hace 20 años.

translation.en: People ran out of food.
Chief fed them with what he could.
translation.es: El jefe alimentaba al pueblo con lo que podía.

translation.en: He saved a lot of people.
He'll make sure it doesn't get that bad again.
translation.es: Él no permitirá que la situación llegue a ese extremo.

translation.en: And if our harvest is okay,
we'll finish paying for William's schooling.
translation.es: podremos pagar la matrícula de William.

translation.en: And university?
I don't know.
How did you know Papa was the man you'd marry?
translation.es: ¿Cómo supiste que te casarías con papá?

translation.en: Is someone talking to you?
No, I'm just curious.
There's no one for you in Wimbe.
translation.es: No hay nadie para ti en Wimbe.

translation.en: I know.
Annie, we'll get you off to university.
translation.es: Annie, te enviaremos a la universidad.

translation.en: You won't just be a wife and mother.
translation.es: No solo serás esposa y madre.

translation.en: No one's been talking?
No one's been talking.
[William in English] I found another battery.
It's dead, but if you take out the bad cells,
translation.es: Está descargada, pero si le quitas las celdas malas,

translation.en: and connect the positive and negative with this one,
translation.es: y conectas el positivo y el negativo a esta otra,

translation.en: we can make a good battery.
But it needs to charge. It needs electricity.
translation.es: Pero hay que cargarla. Necesitamos electricidad.

translation.en: With electricity, we can fix the pump.
We never know what's happening with the rain.
translation.es: Nunca sabemos qué pasará con la lluvia.

translation.en: [Gilbert] What are you doing?
[William] All I have to do is skip assembly. I'll only go to science class for now.
translation.es: Solo debo faltar a la reunión. Solo iré a la clase de ciencias por ahora.

translation.en: Class, make sure your homework of exercise three is on my desk at 9 a.m. tomorrow morning.
translation.es: Deben entregarme el ejercicio tres mañana a las 9:00 de la mañana.

translation.en: [William] Mr. Kachigunda.
[Mr. Kachigunda] William.
When you turn the wheel on your bike, the light shines.
translation.es: Cuando gira la rueda de su bicicleta, la luz se enciende.

translation.en: -Yes. -How?
A dynamo.
How does a dynamo work?
There's a little man on the inside who rubs his hands together...
translation.es: Un hombrecito en el interior se frota las manos...

translation.en: It's, uh, magnets.
-Where can I find a dynamo? -You should try the trading center.
translation.es: - ¿Dónde hallo un dínamo? - En el centro de intercambio.

translation.en: I'm not sure if they'll have one there. Mine came from Lilongwe.
translation.es: No sé si tendrán uno allí. El mío vino de Lilongwe.

translation.en: Well, what would I need to make one?
I'm not sure exactly. A few things.
Uh, a magnet, wiring, something to break the magnetic field.
translation.es: Imanes, cables, algo que rompa el campo magnético.

translation.en: If you try the library, maybe you will find something there.
translation.es: Busca en la biblioteca a ver si encuentras algo.

translation.en: I don't have a library card.
Because your parents haven't paid.
How do you know I will not tell Mr. Ofesi that you're coming to my class?
translation.es: ¿Cómo sabes que no le diré al señor Ofesi que vienes a clases?

translation.en: Because I can keep a secret, sir.
A secret?
Yes, sir.
There is a man who comes to my village to see my sister...
translation.es: Un hombre viene a mi aldea a ver a mi hermana...

translation.en: sir.
-[woman] Mr. Kachigunda. -Mrs. Sikelo.
This is William Kamkwamba. He's part of my science class.
translation.es: Él es William Kamkwamba. Está en mi clase de ciencias.

translation.en: He's no longer a student here, but he and I have been working on various experiments,
translation.es: Ya no estudia aquí, pero él y yo trabajamos en varios experimentos.

translation.en: and I'd like for him to continue his studies here in the library.
translation.es: Quiero que continúe estudiando en la biblioteca.

translation.en: -Does Mr. Ofesi know about this? -Of course.
translation.es: - ¿El señor Ofesi lo sabe? - Por supuesto.

translation.en: Mr. Ofesi's only stipulation
is the boy is not to be taught or assisted by you or any other teacher.
translation.es: que el niño no debe recibir ayuda de usted ni de otros maestros.

translation.en: It's important to him that the boy working here is not common knowledge.
translation.es: Él no quiere que se sepa que el niño estudia aquí.

translation.en: He himself would prefer not to be reminded of the fact.
translation.es: Y tampoco quiere que se lo recuerden.

translation.en: Of course.
-Good luck. -Thank you, sir.
Perhaps you should sit away from the window.
translation.es: Deberías sentarte lejos de la ventana.

translation.en: Ms. Sikelo.
Mr. Kamkwamba.
Are there any books on dynamos?
Dynamos?
Magnets and electricity?
Is this in your class grade?
Maybe I can work with a dictionary.
All the senior textbooks are on the bottom shelf on the left.
translation.es: Los libros avanzados están en el estante de abajo a la izquierda.

translation.en: [Mrs. Sikelo] Mr. Kamkwamba? Did you find what you were looking for?
-Welcome, Mr. President. -Thank you very much. How are you?
Thank you for coming Mr. President. Welcome.
translation.es: Gracias por venir, señor presidente. Bienvenido.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Thank you, thank you.
Clap your hands and cheer.
People, I'm saying N.U.P.
translation.es: Amigos, digo Partido de Unidad Nacional.

translation.en: [crowd] Government!
Say it three times.
[in English] Uh, but first of all, I'd like to thank you, Your Excellency,
for honoring the inauguration of Chief Mamba.
translation.es: por honrar la investidura del jefe Mamba.

translation.en: Can you please stand, Chief?
[in Chichewa] And now I'll leave the mic to Chief Wimbe.
translation.es: Ahora le daré el micrófono al jefe Wimbe.

translation.en: [in English] Your Excellency,
may I first congratulate you on your achievements in government,
translation.es: permítame felicitarlo por los logros de su gobierno

translation.en: and state that I hope in the coming election,
translation.es: y decir que espero que en las próximas elecciones

translation.en: you will emerge victorious.
You have been a key factor in our peace and stability,
translation.es: Usted ha sido un elemento clave para la paz y la estabilidad.

translation.en: when we have seen the responsibility of government
translation.es: Hemos visto que la responsabilidad de los gobiernos

translation.en: devolve into chaos across Africa.
However, the recent floods have created a dangerous situation.
translation.es: Sin embargo, las inundaciones han generado una situación peligrosa.

translation.en: In many regions, we already know the harvest will fail.
translation.es: Ya sabemos que la cosecha será mala en muchas regiones.

translation.en: We know the economic machinery is not pointed towards us,
translation.es: Sabemos que la maquinaria económica no apunta hacia nosotros,

translation.en: but we are now a democracy.
We are prepared to make our voices heard in the ballot box.
translation.es: Haremos oír nuestras voces en las urnas.

translation.en: -What is this man trying to do? -We need an assurance of emergency grain.
translation.es: - ¿Qué intenta lograr? - Deben garantizarnos que habrá granos.

translation.en: We need to know any food issue will be slaughtered in its infancy.
translation.es: Debemos saber que no permitirán que pasemos hambre.

translation.en: We need a government prepared to support its people.
translation.es: Necesitamos un gobierno que apoye al pueblo.

translation.en: I want to vote for this government,
but cannot vote for any man
translation.es: Pero no votaré por ningún hombre...

translation.en: who will turn two blind eyes to a catastrophe.
translation.es: ...que haga la vista gorda ante una catástrofe.

translation.en: [man] Democracy at work. Freedom of expression.
translation.es: Esta es la democracia. Libertad de expresión.

translation.en: Well, His Excellency will address this misunderstanding,
translation.es: Su Excelencia comentará sobre este malentendido,

translation.en: but for now, let's have some music.
translation.es: pero por ahora, disfrutemos de un poco de música.

translation.en: Gilbert!
[in Chichewa] Father! Father!
William!
William!
[in Chichewa] Why don't they take him to a clinic?
translation.es: ¿Por qué no lo llevan a una clínica?

translation.en: He's safer here.
Would they come back?
We don't know.
You have to be a man now, William.
translation.es: Debes ser un hombre ahora, William.

translation.en: No one is coming to help us.
I need you to work with me on this harvest.
For every piece of grain we can get.
translation.es: Para cada grano que logremos obtener.

translation.en: Yes, sir.
[man] Trywell.
Thank you.
[in Chichewa] Is that all there is?
It's not even five bags.
Sixty days.
[Trywell] Sixty to seventy.
[Agnes] With a year till the next harvest.
translation.es: Y falta un año para la siguiente cosecha.

translation.en: It's not enough.
We have savings.
It's not enough.
[in Chichewa] The government is denying a food crisis.
translation.es: El gobierno niega la crisis alimentaria.

translation.en: What?
-They won't admit it's happening. -[man speaking in Chichewa on radio]
The corrupt government is only interested in securing victory in the coming election.
translation.es: Al gobierno corrupto solo le interesa ganar las próximas elecciones.

translation.en: We demand assurances from our leadership.
Tell us who will support our communities when the food runs out?
translation.es: ¿Quién apoyará a nuestras comunidades cuando se acabe la comida?

translation.en: There's an opposition rally in Nkhata Bay.
translation.es: Hay una manifestación de la oposición en Nkhata Bay.

translation.en: -They're getting a truck. -Another rally?
The opposition can put pressure on the government.
translation.es: La oposición puede presionar al gobierno.

translation.en: -Where can we get the best price? -I'll take care of it.
translation.es: - ¿Dónde obtenemos el mejor precio? - Yo me ocuparé.

translation.en: -Uh-huh. -[Agnes] You're going?
The government doesn't want us to make noise.
translation.es: El gobierno no quiere que hagamos ruido.

translation.en: The opposition people need our support.
translation.es: Los de la oposición necesitan nuestro apoyo.

translation.en: Make noise here if you want to make noise. Stay with your family.
translation.es: Si quieres hacer ruido, hazlo aquí. Quédate con tu familia.

translation.en: We'll be back tonight. Tomorrow at the latest.
translation.es: Regresaré esta noche. Mañana a más tardar.

translation.en: We need to make sure people know what's happening here.
translation.es: Debemos asegurarnos de que se sepa lo que pasa aquí.

translation.en: [Mrs. Sikelo in English] So, you use the windmill to charge the battery?
translation.es: ¿Entonces usas el molino para cargar la batería?

translation.en: And the battery powers a pump.
translation.es: Y la batería enciende la bomba.

translation.en: We can plant in the dry season. Two harvests.
translation.es: Podremos plantar en la estación seca. Dos cosechas.

translation.en: We can plant now and we won't run out of food.
translation.es: Podemos plantar ahora y no nos faltará comida.

translation.en: With Mr. Kachigunda's dynamo, I can do it.
translation.es: Puedo hacerlo con el dínamo del señor Kachigunda.

translation.en: Go to his class.
Ask him.
I don't want you staying in this village anymore.
translation.es: No quiero que te quedes en esta aldea.

translation.en: Not with all of these problems.
Where do you want me to go?
I have people in Mangochi.
We can travel there and marry.
You want me to run away?
You want me to disgrace my family?
I love you. I don't know what's more important than this.
translation.es: Te amo. No sé qué es más importante que eso.

translation.en: We can come back when I can pay them a bride price.
translation.es: Regresaremos cuando pueda pagar la dote.

translation.en: We'll do everything right then. I promise.
translation.es: Entonces lo haremos como se debe. Lo prometo.

translation.en: Can you pay them a bride price now?
There's no money for teachers.
translation.es: No hay dinero para los maestros.

translation.en: So many students are leaving because of the harvest.
translation.es: Muchos alumnos se van por lo de la cosecha.

translation.en: They may close the school.
There's nothing here for us. There's nothing in Wimbe.
translation.es: Aquí no hay nada para nosotros. No hay nada en Wimbe.

translation.en: Nothing for you.
-You should go back to school. -I don't care about school.
translation.es: - Debes regresar a la escuela. - No me importa la escuela.

translation.en: We can leave now. I can arrange it. Annie.
translation.es: Podemos irnos ahora. Puedo organizarlo. Annie.

translation.en: -Annie. -How can I go to Mangochi?
I can't even speak Yao.
They speak English in Mangochi, and you can learn Yao.
translation.es: Hablan inglés en Mangochi y puedes aprender yao.

translation.en: [Mr. Ofesi] Class, I'll be taking your science lesson this morning.
translation.es: Alumnos, yo les daré la clase de ciencias hoy.

translation.en: Stand up.
My father will pay, sir.
You are stealing from the family of every remaining student in this school.
translation.es: Les robas a las familias de los alumnos que quedan en la escuela.

translation.en: My father will pay, sir.
You're stealing from myself and from every member of faculty.
translation.es: Nos robas a mí y a todos los maestros.

translation.en: My father will pay.
You're expelled from Kachokolo,
and you will never be allowed to study here again or any school in this district.
translation.es: y jamás volverás a estudiar aquí ni en ninguna otra escuela del distrito.

translation.en: -Collect your things and go. -Mr. Ofesi.
translation.es: - Toma tus cosas y vete. - Señor Ofesi.

translation.en: Collect your things and go!
[Mr. Ofesi] There's nothing I can do about it, Mrs. Sikelo.
translation.es: No puedo hacer nada al respecto, señora Sikelo.

translation.en: I cannot ignore him sneaking into the school.
translation.es: No puedo pasar por alto que se metió en la escuela.

translation.en: But he was not sneaking into the school.
translation.es: Pero no se metió en la escuela.

translation.en: Don't you see, Mr. Ofesi?
Can you not see that he's been sneaking out of the fields?
translation.es: ¿No ve que se escapa de los campos?

translation.en: [Agnes in Chichewa] Have you seen your sister?
They caught you at school?
-You knew I was going? -Of course.
They expelled me.
-What's happening? -They're taking grain to Chamama. To sell.
translation.es: - ¿Qué sucede? - Llevan granos a Chamama. Para vender.

translation.en: It's a government truck. They're not leaving us to starve.
translation.es: Es un camión del gobierno. No nos dejarán morir de hambre.

translation.en: Buy grain. As much as you can.
It's government price, not market price. It's cheaper.
translation.es: Son precios del gobierno, no del mercado. Es más barato.

translation.en: Aah! No, take the bike.
Take the bike. [panting]
[shouts in English] Khamba, stay! It's too far.
-[dog barks] -Khamba, stay.
[in Chichewa] Grain! Grain! Grain!
[in Chichewa] Stop!
Stop!
Let's go back.
-[in Chichewa] Where were you? -[Annie] Seeing a friend.
Which friend?
You think I don't see you sneaking out of here?
translation.es: ¿Crees que no veo cuando te escabulles?

translation.en: At night even?
-I've told you-- -[Agnes] I know.
translation.es: - Ya te lo dije. - Ya sé.

translation.en: What?
There's no one for me in Wimbe.
translation.es: No hay nadie para mí en Wimbe.

translation.en: There's nothing for me in Wimbe.
translation.es: No hay nada para mí en Wimbe.

translation.en: So if there's nothing for me in Wimbe, why should I stay in Wimbe?
translation.es: Si no hay nada para mí en Wimbe, ¿por qué quedarme aquí?

translation.en: How can I stay?
-Who are you going with? -That's not what I'm saying.
translation.es: - ¿Con quién irás? - No te lo diré.

translation.en: You want to disgrace your family?
You don't understand.
What do you think you know that I don't?
translation.es: ¿Qué crees que sabes que yo no sé?

translation.en: Madam, I haven't eaten in two days.
translation.es: Señora, hace dos días que no como.

translation.en: Get out.
I don't want to hurt anyone.
-They said to see the Chief... -[baby crying]
but he's dying.
[in Chichewa] How much can they have? There were only two trucks.
translation.es: ¿Cuánto pueden tener? Solo eran dos camiones.

translation.en: [man in Chichewa] Back in line! Back in line!
There will not be enough for everyone today.
translation.es: No habrá suficiente para todos hoy.

translation.en: I can only give you fifteen kilos.
[in Chichewa] I told you not to go!
-What happened? -I told you not to go!
-I told you not to go! -[Trywell] Where's William?
[Agnes] I don't know.
[Trywell] William! Where's William?
[man in Chichewa] We can't just stay here. We'll need to open the door.
translation.es: No podemos esperar más. Tendremos que abrir la puerta.

translation.en: You'll have to run.
Sir. Can you help me?
Please.
[in Chichewa] We can have one meal a day.
translation.es: Alcanza para una comida al día.

translation.en: We should decide which one.
This is crazy.
Agnes?
Supper.
You can't sleep on an empty stomach.
translation.es: No se puede dormir con el estómago vacío.

translation.en: William?
Breakfast.
Why?
I like breakfast.
-My God! -Annie!
You don't raise your voice to your father.
translation.es: No le levantes la voz a tu padre.

translation.en: He left us here.
We could have been raped and killed. If it wasn't for William--
translation.es: Podrían habernos violado y matado. De no ser por William...

translation.en: Your father was trying to save us.
-There's no food! -And so?
You think I'd let you starve to death?
translation.es: ¿Crees que te dejaré morir de hambre?

translation.en: When I cut off my own arm to feed you,
translation.es: Cuando me corte un brazo para alimentarte...

translation.en: then you'll know that you're my child.
Tomorrow, we'll dig ridges and start planting.
translation.es: Mañana cavaremos surcos y comenzaremos a plantar.

translation.en: [man] The ground is too hard. It's the dry season.
translation.es: El suelo está muy duro. Es la estación seca.

translation.en: Nothing will grow.
[Trywell] Then...
we pray for rain.
Dear Father,
fight for this family.
-Bring us rain in this dry season-- -Trywell.
translation.es: - Trae lluvia en la estación seca. - Trywell.

translation.en: Stop.
Eat, Papa.
If you give any food to that dog,
translation.es: Si le das comida a ese perro,

translation.en: I'll break your neck.
[softly] Annie. Annie.
-What is it? -I need you to speak to Mr. Kachigunda.
translation.es: - ¿Qué pasa? - Debes hablar con el señor Kachigunda.

translation.en: I know you're talking to Mr. Kachigunda.
I need to use the dynamo from his bike.
translation.es: Necesito el dínamo de su bicicleta.

translation.en: -The dynamo? -You have to help me, Annie.
Tell him he has to let me use the dynamo.
translation.es: Dile que me deje usar el dínamo.

translation.en: I can fix a water pump. I know how to do it.
translation.es: Sé cómo reparar una bomba de agua.

translation.en: I can bring water. I can make rain.
translation.es: Puedo traer agua y hacer llover.

translation.en: But I need the dynamo.
[in Chichewa] Mama, what happened?
[sobbing] She's gone with teacher.
Did you see her? Did you see her?
[William] No, sir.
Are you lying to me?
-Where did they go? -I don't know, sir.
Bring me my daughter, William.
-I don't know, sir. I don't know! -Bring me my daughter!
translation.es: - No sé, señor. - ¡Tráeme a mi hija!

translation.en: [in English] "One less."
She says, "One less."
"One less mouth to feed."
translation.es: "Una menos. Una boca menos que alimentar".

translation.en: [in English] I'll do everything I can to find an address, but right now--
translation.es: Haré lo posible por conseguir la dirección, pero...

translation.en: We have no money to go to Mangochi.
translation.es: No tenemos dinero para ir a Mangochi.

translation.en: I'll do my best to locate Mr. Kachigunda.
Your best?
I'm sorry, we're closing the school for the moment.
translation.es: Perdón. Cerraremos la escuela por el momento.

translation.en: There are not enough students or teachers.
-Is Ms. Sikelo still here? -No.
This hunger will be the last one,
for me and my family, believe me.
translation.es: ...para mí y para mi familia. Créanme.

translation.en: We'll never go through something like this again.
translation.es: No volveremos a pasar por algo como esto.

translation.en: [Agnes] He's starving himself.
Killing himself.
So he doesn't take food from these children.
translation.es: Para no quitarles la comida a sus hijos.

translation.en: Mrs. Kamkwamba--
When we were first married, we promised each other
that we would never pray for rain like our ancestors.
translation.es: ...que no oraríamos por la lluvia como nuestros antepasados.

translation.en: We said we were modern people,
and our children would go to school.
translation.es: ...y que nuestros hijos irían a la escuela.

translation.en: And this is here that Annie met teacher,
translation.es: Y aquí fue donde Annie conoció al maestro.

translation.en: and we paid for it.
-And you even expelled my son. -Not me, Mrs. Kamkwamba.
translation.es: - Y usted expulsó a mi hijo. - No fui yo, señora Kamkwamba.

translation.en: -The government-- -Which government?
The government that beat our chief?
Even if they prayed for rain, the ancestors survived
translation.es: Aunque oraran por la lluvia, los antepasados sobrevivieron...

translation.en: because they stayed together.
When do we stay together, Mr. Headmaster?
What can I do, Mrs. Kamkwamba?
Can I use the library?
[in Chichewa] What's all this?
[in English] An experiment.
In America, electricity made from wind.
translation.es: En EE. UU., la electricidad se genera con el viento.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] With electricity, we can make water.
[in English] We're going to build a windmill.
We need to build a small one first, to see if it works.
translation.es: Uno pequeño primero para ver si funciona.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] All I ate today was pigskin from the drum.
translation.es: Hoy solo comí cuero de cerdo del barril.

translation.en: Don't waste my time.
What do we do?
It has a motor inside. [in English] It turns the cassette tape.
translation.es: Tiene un motor adentro. Hace girar la cinta.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] How are you doing with those blades?
[man in Chichewa] I'm almost there.
[in Chichewa] Okay, open the door.
[boys together in Chichewa] ♪ It's a clever bird ♪
♪ It builds its nest ♪
♪ To protect the others... ♪
[William in Chichewa] Papa.
I want to show you something.
Can you hear it?
What is it?
It's wind energy.
The blades make electricity,
and that powers the radio.
I see.
I want to build a big one. A big one could power a water pump.
translation.es: Quiero construir uno grande para encender una bomba de agua.

translation.en: It means that even if the land is dry,
we can still plant.
It can do that?
Yes.
But to build a big one,
I'll need something to help turn the blades.
translation.es: necesito algo que haga girar las aspas.

translation.en: If I could use your bike, it would work.
translation.es: Podría usar tu bicicleta para hacerlo funcionar.

translation.en: The bike?
It would work.
How long would you need it for?
I'd need to remove the wheels and cut the frame.
translation.es: Debo quitarle las ruedas y cortar el cuadro.

translation.en: You couldn't use it as a bike anymore.
What?
Have you seen what's happening, William?
Yes, sir.
-People are dying. Do you understand? -This will help everyone.
translation.es: - La gente muere. ¿Lo entiendes? - Esto los ayudará a todos.

translation.en: Get this stupidness away from me.
-Papa-- -Get this stupidness away from me!
Papa, I need to take the bike so I can bring electricity.
translation.es: Papá necesito la bicicleta para poder generar electricidad.

translation.en: With electricity, I can make water. I can make rain.
translation.es: Con electricidad, puedo crear agua. Puedo hacer llover.

translation.en: Are you still talking?
There are things I know that you don't know.
translation.es: Sé cosas que tú no sabes.

translation.en: Because you can make toys?
Because of school.
From now on, you get up with me first thing in the morning, understand?
translation.es: Desde ahora, te levantarás conmigo a primera hora, ¿entendido?

translation.en: You help me build these ridges.
translation.es: Me ayudarás a cavar los surcos.

translation.en: Forget about school! Forget about the library!
I don't want to see you near this foolishness again!
translation.es: No quiero volver a verte con estas tonterías.

translation.en: I was wrong!
It's damn well time you learned how to farm!
translation.es: ¡Ya es hora de que aprendas a ser agricultor!

translation.en: Plow the land!
Plow the land!
-[in English] Are you okay? -It's too hot.
Look at the sky.
It won't rain. It won't rain for months.
translation.es: No lloverá. No lloverá durante meses.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Do you think the Gule Wamkulu will come when my father dies?
translation.es: ¿Crees que el Gule Wamkulu vendrá cuando mi padre muera?

translation.en: Even though there's a hunger?
They're supposed to come when a chief dies.
translation.es: Deben venir cuando muere un jefe.

translation.en: -Let's go. -Where?
[in Chichewa] What's happening?
We have to go north while we still can. There's nothing left.
translation.es: Debemos ir al norte mientras podamos. No queda nada.

translation.en: I need your help.
-[in English] If we stay, we die. -No.
We find another bike and we build the windmill.
translation.es: Buscamos una bicicleta y construimos el molino.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] You're mad. A bike from where?
There's no one in the trading center. Everyone is leaving the village.
translation.es: No hay nadie en el centro de intercambio. Todos se están yendo.

translation.en: -[in English] It was a toy, William. -It's not a toy. I showed you.
translation.es: - Era un juguete, William. - No. Les mostré cómo funciona.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] What if there's no food in the north?
translation.es: ¿Y si no hay comida en el norte?

translation.en: [in English] You'll die.
[in Chichewa] If you're sure it will work, William,
translation.es: Si estás seguro de que funcionará,

translation.en: why don't you just take your father's bike?
translation.es: ¿por qué no usas la bicicleta de tu padre?

translation.en: Why don't you just take it?
Papa.
[in Chichewa] What's this?
We need to take the bike, Papa.
[in English] You want to fight me?
We don't want to fight you, Trywell. We just want you to give William the bike.
translation.es: No queremos pelear, Trywell. Solo que le des la bicicleta a William.

translation.en: Get away from my house.
-He can bring water. -You say.
[in Chichewa] I can bring water.
-All year round. -You're a big man now, huh?
translation.es: - Todo el año. - Eres un hombre ahora, ¿no?

translation.en: [in English] Big men.
Fight me.
[in Chichewa] Do it!
I'm your father!
I'm your father!
[William in English] Wait.
[in Chichewa] Come with us, William. Let's leave.
[William in English] I can't.
I have to go home.
I need to be with my father.
[in English] Khamba, come.
[voice trembles] Khamba.
[Trywell in Chichewa] He tried to fight me,
with his friends,
for the bike.
Will you give it to him?
Of course not.
How much should I lose, Trywell?
Everywhere I followed you,
I lost something.
My parents,
when I came here.
Then the land.
Then we lost Annie.
You're blaming me?
I'm not blaming you.
I'm asking you.
When do we stop losing?
Nothing we have done has worked.
[in Chichewa] John said we'd grow tobacco.
Tobacco that looked like milk chocolate,
translation.es: Tabaco que pareciera leche con chocolate...

translation.en: for 2,000 kwacha a kilo.
I'm sorry, Papa.
Sometimes it's dreams,
and sometimes it's just lies.
It's not a dream, Papa.
I'm not dreaming.
That's why he didn't leave the land to me.
translation.es: Por eso no me dejó las tierras a mí.

translation.en: He didn't trust me.
He never did.
He knew I'd fail.
Like I have.
You didn't fail me. Never.
translation.es: A mí no me decepcionaste. Nunca.

translation.en: I went to school.
Water?
Yes, sir.
From wind?
It can work,
if you help me.
Okay.
[in English] You can bring it up. I'm ready.
[Trywell in Chichewa] Have you got it?
Be careful, William.
[in English] It needs to charge. The battery needs to charge.
translation.es: Debe cargarse. La batería debe cargarse.

translation.en: [in Chichewa] Go to the chief's house and bring seeds. We'll plant vegetables.
translation.es: Vayan a casa del jefe y traigan semillas. Plantaremos verduras.

translation.en: We'll get through while we wait for the grain to grow.
translation.es: Sobreviviremos mientras esperamos que crezcan los granos.

translation.en: [in English] Go to them, Gilbert.
[in Chichewa] Mrs. Sikelo wants to bring the new government's representative
translation.es: La señora Sikelo quiere traer al representante del nuevo gobierno

translation.en: for the schools district to see the windmill.
translation.es: en el distrito escolar para que vea el molino.

translation.en: She says there may be a scholarship for a school in Madisi.
translation.es: Dice que quizá haya una beca para una escuela en Madisi.

translation.en: I think I should stay here.
At least till Annie comes back.
translation.es: Al menos hasta que Annie regrese.

translation.en: I think I should stay and help you with the land.
translation.es: Debo quedarme y ayudarte con las tierras.

translation.en: I've been thinking about this machine, William.
translation.es: Estuve pensando en esta máquina, William.

translation.en: I've been thinking about how it will carry you away and keep you here at the same time.
translation.es: Estuve pensando en cómo te alejará y te retendrá aquí al mismo tiempo.

translation.en: Because no one can see this thing and not think of you.
translation.es: Porque nadie podría mirarla y no pensar en ti.

translation.en: No one would want to.
Wherever you are.
Go to school.
